it.polimi.group03

Class Test

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.group03.Test

  • public class Test
extends java.lang.Object
    This class was implemented for specific testing purposes established in the requirements of the delivery of the project. It should be used only for tests based on strings. The principal method of the class is moveTest(String) and it is the one that should be used for testing. Some minor validations have been made to avoid problems with the format of the entered strings.

    Please consider the following:

    • When a Game has finished (without errors) the "moving player" character showed in the string returned by the method moveTest(String) will be the last player who made a move regardless if he/she has lost or not.
    • The class GameEngine performs a validation whenever a user wants to placed a bead on the board, it states that if a bead is placed over an empty slot, it will return an error message.
    For unit tests please refer to GameTest
    Since:
    11/11/2015.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    cecibloom, megireci, tatibloom

        Parameters:

      • moveTest

        public java.lang.String moveTest(java.lang.String inputString)
        This method performs several actions in order to test the game mechanics. It uses mainly the methods ands classes created in the model and some others added to this class to perform validations to the input and returning the results. This method is prepared to receive a string input that complies with the following pattern:
        • [01] number of players +
        • [01] moving player +
        • [07] positions of the horizontal bars +
        • [07] positions of the vertical bars +
        • [49] beads in the grid +
        • [3*n] moves.
        Parameters:
        inputString - A 68+ character string that contains the configurations and movements to be tested
        Returns:
        string A 65-character string with the resulting state of the moves, in the same format as the first 65 characters of the input if it was possible to perform all the moves and configurations established in the input, or an error message indicating what went wrong e.g "error: "
        See Also:
        GameEngine, GameTest

      • printBoard
